comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I'd say this is a view of Bourbong St, Bundaberg. This 1894 illustration, by Queenslander artist J.Cecil Gasking, appears to show the same view...possibly drawn from a print of this very photograph nla.gov.au/nla.news-article20717372 ; I'd say the pic was taken from the Bundaberg Post Office tower...presumably in ca. 1894...possibly during/after the 1893 flood... Info on the Grand Hotel, built 1885 (still standing!), architect F.D.G. Stanley ; nla.gov.au/nla.news-article84141137 ; 1907 Queenslander pic nla.gov.au/nla.news-article22269138 ..per a pic held at the SLQ, further addtions were evidently made in 1893

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] Wow - so similar! The Post Office tower was clearly a good spot for photographers/ artists.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
